context: Dell Technologies was formed from the September 2016 merger of Dell and EMC Corporation. By 2020, Dell was using the Dell EMC brand with some products (phased out around 2020). Dell EMC owned over a quarter of the global enterprise storage market, making it the runaway leader. Competition spanned enterprise storage, data protection, backup/recovery, and cloud storage. Dell Technologies competed across infrastructure, virtualization, data management, and hybrid cloud solutions.

competitors.name: NetApp
competitors.notes: One of the largest names in data storage market alongside Dell EMC; major enterprise storage competitor

competitors.name: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)
competitors.notes: Top competitor in enterprise storage, servers, and infrastructure with intelligent edge-to-cloud solutions

competitors.notes: Enterprise storage vendor with all-flash infrastructure and cloud integration
